outlook_24_72h.base_case: The conflict is on an escalating trajectory with no de-escalation signals. Iran has demonstrated capability and willingness to conduct large-scale simultaneous attacks on multiple US bases and Israeli targets. IRGC's announcement of continued waves (phases 3–4) suggests further retaliation is planned. If Khamenei's death is confirmed, leadership chaos may either paralyze or further radicalize Iranian response. US-Israeli forces will likely continue degrading Iranian military assets. Expect sustained intensity with daily major incidents for at least 48–72 hours.
escalation_risks: Khamenei's confirmed death could trigger erratic or maximum-pressure Iranian response including WMD threshold actions
Expanded Houthi involvement in Red Sea could open new front
Israeli ground operations or expanded strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities
China or Russia intervention escalating to great power confrontation
Iranian attacks on Gulf oil infrastructure triggering global energy crisis
outlook_24_72h.de_escalation_pathways: Unlikely in 24–72h window. Possible pathways include: major power mediation (Turkey, China, Russia) pushing for ceasefire; complete collapse of Iranian command structure post-Khamenei; US domestic political pressure (war powers legislation) constraining further strikes; or overwhelming US-Israeli degradation of Iranian capacity forcing Tehran to accept negotiated settlement. Currently no diplomatic channel active — UN Secretary-General's regrets highlight failed diplomacy.
